intro: Euphrasia biancae, commonly known as the white eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branched. Euphrasia biancae is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
